duties_responsibilities.duty: Enforce all authorized laws, rules, and regulations to protect life and property against theft, misappropriation, vandalism, fire, flood, or similar disaster.
Provide vehicle transportation support function under the direction of the supervisor in compliance with government, corporate, and management directives.
Investigate vehicular accidents at the center and issue visitor passes and temporary vehicle permits.
Maintain harmonious relationships with local law enforcement agencies and provide escort service as directed.
Participate in the disciplinary process as established at the center, including zero tolerance for violence and drugs.
Maintain accountability of staff, students, and property, adhering to safety practices in all areas of responsibility.
Cultivate and maintain a climate on the center that is free of harassment, intimidation, bullying, and disrespect to provide a safe place for staff and students to work and learn.

education_certification.credential: High School graduate or equivalent (Prefer 1 year of experience in a security department, law enforcement agency, or experience with security duties).
Valid driver’s license with acceptable driving record preferred (Prefer Commercial Driver’s License (CDL))
Prefer knowledge of riot and crowd control techniques and law enforcement procedures.
Must maintain CPR/FA Certification. Ability to obtain a bus driver's license.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written. Position requires an ability to operate office equipment and drive an automobile.
